lexUnit.name: tug.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to pull on something hard and suddenly

sentence.text: Then he glanced aside , and yelled , ` Watch out ! " as he tugged his axe free .
She tugged her housecoat tighter around her body , poured a large mug of sweet tea , and began to climb the stairs .
Suddenly , as we were boarding , he tugged me by the sleeve and said quietly : ` You 'd better pull your socks up , or you 'll be playing for your place . "
He tugged me by the sleeve and pointed to Santerre 's wife .
Pigeons found sheltered ledges , dogs that were normally unconcerned snarled as their owners tugged them on leashes .
` Now if you 'd be kind enough to phone up DS Wootton and order him to charge Hebden " he tugged his face into an edgy smile .
He tugged his hair over his left eye , then jerked his head to flip it back : a gesture that revealed his anxiety .
Someone was tugging my arm .
` Real hair , " he said , tugging his beard .
David tugged a lock of black hair .
Doc Threadneedle tugged her sleeve .
Lee tugged the wire .
She tugged her arm furiously .
" I had noticed , and stop tugging my hair so hard , you clumsy wretch . "
Keith pulled a face at her and tugged his hair despairingly .
He tugged gently at her plait .
The old man tugged gently on the line .
` Best be careful then , " and he tugged gently at the vest .
Henry tugged gently at the horse 's mane .
A silver fish-hook tangled in his curls , dangled by Izzie , and when he woke she was tugging gently on his hair .
They looked at him , then at the tracker where he squatted in his sheepskins with his brown hand tugging at his beard .

Dexter felt there was something strange about Beasley but could only place it when Lancaster 's friend raised his right hand to tug at his beard : the last two fingers were no more than withered stumps .
He went into the cabin and tugged at Dickie 's arm .
` Let's go back , " said Dot , tugging at Gloria 's hand .
Spittals tugged at the knees of his trousers and began to rub his palms together again , this time more slowly , as if he were rolling a rod of plasticine between them .
All this time his friend has been tugging at my shoulder .
Rosa took her place in church beside them and her little brother tugged at her sleeve , and asked , showing gappy teeth like a crone , ` Are you going to join the sisters , Rosa ? "
She tugged earnestly on Cleo 's boot .
The rain remained a moist guess in the air , though they had to tug on their cloaks against the cold in the wind .
He straightened up slowly and tugged cautiously on his end of the rope .
She tugged on Penry 's hand as the path levelled out .
Martin tugged on the reins for a moment , then turned and looked at his brother , saying , ` It has n't arrived ? "
He tugged on Rory 's sleeve and in a low monotone said , ` Dad , I 'm bored , dad ; dad , are we nearly finished yet , dad ?
St Margaret tugged firmly on her thread .
Midnight tugged with his fettered arm : ` Come , I show you . "
Henry got hold of the foot and tugged .
He tugged harder , but it was caught fast .
While he was blinded , Jane grabbed his beard with both hands and tugged .
He was tugging anxiously at one earlobe , and the silence continued to hang between them , though Nunzia slapped and stirred at the range .
He rubbed his nose , tugged at an earlobe , shuffled his feet on the carpet .

But the ideas and mystique that have always made this an extraordinarily special place rise above the ebbing and flowing concerns of present - day Jerusalem as it continues to tug at the world 's attention into the new millennium .
